text: gurgling is the fastest developing city
in India carved out of farmland by
private developers outside Delhi
it's home to fortune 500 companies
towering apartment blocks and two dozen
shopping malls I had not happen the rest
of India's development would not have
happened either because Gurgaon became a
pacesetter
for the other cities to follow her Gowen
is viewed as a symbol of India's
economic might a city created with
little government planning but as its
population boomed that same lack of
governance has become a problem there
are no amenities and 50% of the
electricity connections are not
functioning Gurgaon is advertised as a
world-class City yet it has no citywide
sewer system many residents rich and
poor lack basic public services like
reliable electricity decent roads and
clean water the watering is responsible
for most of the sickness here people who
drink bottled water are not aware of the
diseases spread by the water that we
drink poor people get sick often garbage
collection and water and electricity are
still often handled by private
developers until recently
Gurgaon didn't even have a local
government now a new government is
forming and it's expected to eventually
take control of delivering services not
everyone is looking forward to the
change
Satish Khosla is a technology consultant
who moved here in 1992 he buys his
services from a private company I'm not
too comfortable at going to the
government to be very honest and one of
the reasons is that I I think we are
adding another layer and I don't know I
I think I would say that we will have
whenever it has gone to the government
that things have taken much more a worse
situation at times in our environment
many Indians do not trust government
bureaucracy and Gurgaon does oh its
rapid growth to private developers
critics like Khosla say the government
hasn't used the money it's collected
from residents to provide even basic
services so Husum where is that money
gone I haven't heard of that the lack of
services means many Gurgaon residents
must fend for themselves wealthier
people like mr. Khosla can at least pay
a developer to provide them but many of
the working poor who migrated here for
jobs are left without what can we do if
we go to the slum Lord and ask for clean
water he would just ask us to be Saira
Bano Audry's works for a well-to-do
family but lives in this shanty
neighborhood because of problems back
home life was easier at home I wouldn't
be here while residents like Eid Reis
badly need services the private
developer real estate mogul cushaw Pal
Singh whose company filled Gurgaon says
it's naive to think the government will
be able to do the job my feeling is it's
too big a job that they're competent set
of people in Haryana Urban Development
authorities call but if you give too
much to a person to chew to eat and he
can't conclude means too much food he
will get indigestion at a public meeting
residents of Badshah poor a village
absorbed into Gurgaon complained to the
city commissioner that more isn't being
done why should we budget for residents
request that you take another look at
the problem on face such as the sewage
system drainage and clogged water it's
not as if by complaining or shouting
here you'll find that everything is fine
that's not how it works things will only
work when you have a concrete action
plan Sudhir Raj pal was appointed the
head of the Municipal Corporation a few
months ago the fact is that the demand
is increasing very rapidly and all of us
combined agencies public agencies are
trying their best to make sure that the
supply also increases and increases at a
pace which is able to meet the
increasing demand
but while Raj pal urges patience heed
Reece says hers has run out here the
serigraphy the government is responsible
for all the poor people isn't it I don't
see the government extending help to the
poor I've been living in the Delhi area
for the last eight years I have never
seen any help provided to us your Gowan
is likely to keep up its rapid growth
with or without municipal planning the
challenge is whether local government
can make it a more livable city for all
residents
